member.name: T:Protractor.JavaScriptBy
member.summary: Provides a mechanism by which to find elements within a document using JavaScript.

member.name: M:Protractor.JavaScriptBy.#ctor(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .

member.name: M:Protractor.JavaScriptBy.FindElement(OpenQA.Selenium.ISearchContext)
member.summary: Finds the first element matching the criteria.
member.param: An object to use to search for the elements.
member.returns: The first matching on the current context.

member.name: M:Protractor.JavaScriptBy.FindElements(OpenQA.Selenium.ISearchContext)
member.summary: Finds all elements matching the criteria.
member.param: An object to use to search for the elements.
member.returns: A collection of all matching the current criteria, or an empty list if nothing matches.

member.name: P:Protractor.JavaScriptBy.AdditionalScriptArguments
member.summary: Gets or sets any additional arguments to the script.

member.name: T:Protractor.Ng1BaseModule
member.summary: Module automatically installed by Protractor when a page is loaded with Angular 1.

member.name: T:Protractor.NgModule
member.summary:
Represents an Angular module to load before Angular is loaded.
The modules will be registered after existing modules, so any module registered will override preexisting modules with the same name.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgModule.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .
member.param: The name of the module to load or override.
The JavaScript to load the module.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgModule.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the module to load or override.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgModule.Script
member.summary: Gets or sets the JavaScript to load the module.

member.name: T:Protractor.NgBy
member.summary: Mechanism used to locate elements within Angular applications by binding, model, etc.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgBy.Binding(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find elements by their Angular binding.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgBy.Binding(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find elements by their Angular binding.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.
member.param: Indicates whether or not the binding needs to be matched exactly. By default false.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgBy.ExactBinding(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find elements by their exact Angular binding.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgBy.Model(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find elements by their model name.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgBy.SelectedOption(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find select option elements by their model name.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgBy.Repeater(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find all rows of an ng-repeat.
member.param: The text of the repeater, e.g. 'cat in cats'.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgBy.Repeater(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find all rows of an ng-repeat.
member.param: The text of the repeater, e.g. 'cat in cats'.
Indicates whether or not the repeater needs to be matched exactly. By default, false.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgBy.ExactRepeater(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a mechanism to find all rows of an ng-repeat.
member.param: The exact text of the repeater, e.g. 'cat in cats'.
member.returns: A object the driver can use to find the elements.

member.name: T:Protractor.NgWebDriver
member.summary: Provides a mechanism to write tests against an AngularJS application.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of by wrapping a instance.
member.param: The modules to load before Angular whenever Url setter or Navigate().GoToUrl() is called.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.#ctor(OpenQA.Selenium.IWebDriver,System.String,Protractor.NgModule[])
member.summary: Creates a new instance of by wrapping a instance.
member.param:
The CSS selector for an element on which to find Angular.
This is usually 'body' but if your ng-app is on a subsection of the page it may be a subelement.
The modules to load before Angular whenever Url setter or Navigate().GoToUrl() is called.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.Close
member.summary: Close the current window, quitting the browser if it is the last window currently open.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.Manage
member.summary: Instructs the driver to change its settings.
member.returns: An object allowing the user to change the settings of the driver.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.Navigate
member.summary: Instructs the driver to navigate the browser to another location.
member.returns: An object allowing the user to access the browser's history and to navigate to a given URL.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.Quit
member.summary: Quits this driver, closing every associated window.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.SwitchTo
member.summary: Instructs the driver to send future commands to a different frame or window.
member.returns: An object which can be used to select a frame or window.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.FindElement(OpenQA.Selenium.By)
member.summary: Finds the first using the given mechanism.
member.returns: The first matching on the current context.
member.exception: If no element matches the criteria.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.FindElements(OpenQA.Selenium.By)
member.summary: Finds all s within the current context using the given mechanism.
member.returns: A of all s matching the current criteria, or an empty list if nothing matches.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.WaitForAngular
member.summary: Waits for Angular to finish any ongoing $http, $timeouts, digest cycles etc. This is used before any action on this driver, except if IgnoreSynchonization flag is set to true.
member.remarks: Use NgWebDriver.Manage().Timeouts().SetScriptTimeout() to specify the amount of time the driver should wait for Angular.
member.exception: If Angular could not be found.
If the driver times out while waiting for Angular.

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.ExecuteScript(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes JavaScript in the context of the currently selected frame or window.
member.returns: The value returned by the script.

remarks.para: The method executes JavaScript in the context of the currently selected frame or window. This means that "document" will refer to the current document. If the script has a return value, then the following steps will be taken:

item.description: For an HTML element, this method returns a
For a number, a is returned
For a boolean, a is returned
For all other cases a is returned.
For an array, we check the first element, and attempt to return a of that type, following the rules above. Nested lists are not supported.
If the value is null or there is no return value, is returned.

remarks.para: Arguments must be a number (which will be converted to a ), a , a or a . An exception will be thrown if the arguments do not meet these criteria. The arguments will be made available to the JavaScript via the "arguments" magic variable, as if the function were called via "Function.apply"

member.name: M:Protractor.NgWebDriver.ExecuteAsyncScript(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes JavaScript asynchronously in the context of the currently selected frame or window.
member.returns: The value returned by the script.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgWebDriver.WrappedDriver
member.summary:
Gets the wrapped instance.
Use this to interact with pages that do not contain Angular (such as a log-in screen).

member.name: P:Protractor.NgWebDriver.RootElement
member.summary:
Gets the CSS selector for an element on which to find Angular.
This is usually 'body' but if your ng-app is on a subsection of the page it may be a subelement.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgWebDriver.IgnoreSynchronization
member.summary: If true, Protractor will not attempt to synchronize with the page before performing actions. This can be harmful because Protractor will not wait until $timeouts and $http calls have been processed, which can cause tests to become flaky. This should be used only when necessary, such as when a page continuously polls an API using $timeout.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgWebDriver.CurrentWindowHandle
member.summary: Gets the current window handle, which is an opaque handle to this window that uniquely identifies it within this driver instance.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgWebDriver.PageSource
member.summary: Gets the source of the page last loaded by the browser.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgWebDriver.Title
member.summary: Gets the title of the current browser window.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgWebDriver.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL the browser is currently displaying.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgWebDriver.WindowHandles
member.summary: Gets the window handles of open browser windows.

member.name: P:Protractor.NgWebDriver.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the location for in-page navigation using the same syntax as '$location.url()'.

members.member: All scripts to be run on the client via ExecuteAsyncScript or ExecuteScript should be put here. These scripts are transmitted over the wire using their toString representation, and cannot reference external variables. They can, however use the array passed in to arguments. Instead of params, all functions on clientSideScripts should list the arguments array they expect.

Wait until Angular has finished rendering and has no outstanding $http calls before continuing.
arguments[0] {string} The selector housing an ng-app arguments[1] {function} callback
Tests whether the angular global variable is present on a page. Retries in case the page is just loading slowly.

Continue to bootstrap Angular.
arguments[0] {array} The module names to load.

Return the current location using $location.url().
arguments[0] {string} The selector housing an ng-app

Browse to another page using in-page navigation.
arguments[0] {string} The selector housing an ng-app arguments[1] {string} In page URL using the same syntax as $location.url()
